This MATLAB function or [THR_VAL,L2_Perf,N0_Perf] = mswcmptp(DEC,METH,PARAM) computes the vectors THR_VAL, L2_Perf and N0_Perf obtained after a compression using the METH method and, if required, the PARAM parameter (see mswcmp for more information on METH and PARAM).

refItems.refpurpose: Penalized threshold for wavelet packet denoising

This MATLAB function returns a wavelet packet tree object tobj corresponding to the wavelet packet decomposition of the vector x at level n, using Shannon entropy and the wavelet specified by wname (see wfilters for more information).
This MATLAB function returns a wavelet packet tree T corresponding to the wavelet packet decomposition of the matrix X, at level N, with the specified wavelet wname using Shannon entropy.

refItems.refpurpose: Denoising or compression using wavelet packets
refItems.description: wpdencmp performs a denoising or compression process of a signal or image using wavelet packets.
This MATLAB function computes the wavelet packets for a wavelet 'wname' (see wfilters for more information), on dyadic intervals of length 2-PREC.
This MATLAB function returns a matrix of wavelet packet spectrum estimates, spec, for the binary wavelet packet tree object, wpt.

examples.title: Wavelet Packet Spectrum of Chirp Signal

refItems.refpurpose: Best level tree wavelet packet analysis
refItems.description: This MATLAB function computes the modified wavelet packet tree T corresponding to the best level tree decomposition.
besttree is a one- or two-dimensional wavelet packet analysis function that computes the optimal subtree of an initial tree with respect to an entropy type criterion.

This MATLAB function or T = entrupd(T,ENT,PAR) returns for a given wavelet packet tree T, the updated tree using the entropy function ENT with the optional parameter PAR (see wenergy for more information).

This MATLAB function returns a complete wavelet packet tree T of order order corresponding to a wavelet packet decomposition of x at level depth, using Shannon entropy and the wavelet specified by wname.
This MATLAB function returns the value of the wavelet packet tree T property specified by propname.

refItems.refpurpose: Extract wavelet tree from wavelet packet tree
refItems.description: This MATLAB function computes the modified wavelet packet tree T corresponding to the wavelet decomposition tree.
wpcoef is a one- or two-dimensional wavelet packet analysis function.
This MATLAB function cuts the tree T at level L.
This MATLAB function returns the modified wavelet packet tree T corresponding to a recomposition of the node N.
This MATLAB function reconstructs coefficients of the node 0 of the wavelet packet tree T.
This MATLAB function returns the reconstructed vector x corresponding to the wavelet packet tree object tobj.

examples.title: Reconstruct Signal from Wavelet Packet Tree Object

refItems.description: This MATLAB function returns the reconstructed matrix X corresponding to a wavelet packet tree T.
This MATLAB function returns the modified wavelet packet tree T corresponding to the decomposition of the node N.
This MATLAB function returns a new wavelet packet tree NT obtained from the wavelet packet tree T by coefficients thresholding.
This MATLAB function plots the colored coefficients for the terminal nodes of the wavelet packet tree T using the color mode cmode.

refItems.refpurpose: Reconstruct single branch from 1-D wavelet coefficients
refItems.description: This MATLAB function reconstructs the coefficients vector of type type based on the wavelet decomposition structure [c,l] of a 1-D signal (see wavedec for more information) using the wavelet specified by wname.

refItems.refpurpose: Reconstruct single branch from 2-D wavelet coefficients
refItems.description: wrcoef2 is a two-dimensional wavelet analysis function.
This MATLAB function reverses the vector x.
This MATLAB function writes coefficients for the terminal node NODE.
